{{also|mogen}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|goh|mugan}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*maganÄ…}}, from {{der|de|ine-pro|*megÊ°-}}. [[would like]] to; to [[wish]] to (do something) #: {{ux|de|Ich '''mÃ¶chte''' sie nicht fragen.|I don't '''want''' to ask her.|inline=1}} ====Usage notes==== * As with all modal verbs, the past participle ''gemocht'' is used in the perfect tenses only when the verb is not followed by another infinitive: ''KÃ¤se habe ich noch nie '''gemocht'''.'' â€“ â€œI've never '''liked''' cheese.â€ When an infinitive follows, ''mÃ¶gen'' itself also stands in the infinitive (double infinitive construction): ''Ich habe sie nicht fragen '''mÃ¶gen'''.'' â€“ â€œI was hesitant to ask her.â€ * ''MÃ¶chte'' and its forms are grammatically the past subjunctive of ''mÃ¶gen'', but are never used as such in contemporary German. The conditional of ''mÃ¶gen'' needs to be paraphrased with {{m|de|wÃ¼rde}}: ''Wenn ich KÃ¤se '''mÃ¶gen wÃ¼rde''', kÃ¶nnte ich viel mehr Gerichte essen.'' â€“ â€œIf I '''liked''' cheese, I could eat many more dishes.â€ * ''MÃ¶chte'' is in fact used as a somewhat more polite synonym of {{m|de|wollen||to want}} in the present indicative: ''Wenn ich KÃ¤se '''mÃ¶chte''', sage ich dir bescheid.'' â€“ â€œIf I '''want''' cheese, I'll let you know.â€ (synonymous with: ''Wenn ich KÃ¤se '''will''',''...). In colloquial German, the split between ''mÃ¶gen'' and ''mÃ¶chte'' is so clear-cut that the latter may be interpreted as an independent verb and hence used in the infinitive: ''Du hast hier gar nix zu '''mÃ¶chten'''!'' â€“ â€œYou're not in the position to express wishes!â€ This is, however, nonstandard. * In dated or regional speech, the present indicative of ''mÃ¶gen'' may be used interchangeably with ''mÃ¶chte'', particularly in questions: '''''Magst''' du was trinken?'' â€“ â€œ'''Would''' you '''like''' something to drink?â€ This is normal in Austro-Bavarian areas. In most other regions it is less common and likely to sound affected. ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-pp|mÃ¶g|mag|moch|mÃ¶ch|gemocht|h}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|mÃ¶glich}} * {{l|de|vermÃ¶gen}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|bor=1|gmw-cfr|mÃ¼jje}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:German modal verbs]] ---- ==Low German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|nds|mÃ¤gen}} * {{l|nds|mÃ¼gen}} {{q|Paderbornisch}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|nds|gml|mÈ«gen}}, from {{inh|nds|osx|mugan}}, from {{inh|nds|gem-pro|*maganÄ…}}, from {{der|nds|ine-pro|*megÊ°-}}. It can also be used along with an infinitive with the meaning "to want, would like, wish". ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|may}} {{l|nds|kÃ¶nen}}, {{l|nds|kÃ¼nnen}} * {{sense|want}} {{l|nds|wÃ¼llen}}, {{l|nds|wÃ¼nschen}} * {{sense|like}} {{l|nds|leefhebben}}
